name: Novotel Coffs Harbour Pacific Bay Resort

reviews.text: Australia day floods & closed roads meant that I was not getting home to Ballina tonight. After staying at a budget motel on the out trip decided to go upmarket. Being a public hoilday & the weather it was refreshing to be met by a warm smile and we were quickly checked in taking advantage of an offered special, which included breakfast.
reviews.title: Flooded in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was clean & well appointed all though a bit dated. Twins beds & soft pillows. Bathroom was large & clean. Air con was in the room so was a bit noisey.
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations and more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed a quite drink in the lounge bar but did not use the restaurant. Note the restaurant is a short walk from accommodation buildings. Breakfast was well set out & had all the stables.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, but overpriced for restaurant and accommodation
Overnight stay
reviews.text: Pools, tennis, golf, spa and other activites are all there but both weather and time did not allow us to use them.
We booked 7 nights at this hotel. There were some great points and some very poor ones.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the postive side: we had a 1 bedroom spa suite, with a laundry, kitchen with dishwasher and convection microwave, stove top. Double sofa bed in lounge room, with partitions to separate the rooms. Great innovation was the ability to spin TV around from Lounge to Bedroom via built-in cupboard.
reviews.title: One of the worst I've been to when on hols

likes.liked: — A bit over half way between Sydney and Brisbane
likes.disliked: — The list is rather long and covers most qualifications for which you book a hotel room

reviews.text: Most staff were friendly and helpful. Not on the beachfront but very easy walk to it. NIce Kid's Club.
reviews.title: Timeshare Orphan
Carefree Coffs
reviews.text: Questionables: Swimming pools. One 25m pool designed for the energetic - no wallowing. The alternative pool was a walk from the main complex, max 90cm deep and attached to the toddler pool. Difficult to cater for energetic children and lazy parents in same spot! Pool Bar located at this pool - howver not open during our stay. (Uncertain from appearance when it last opened)

Negatives: Restaurant was a disappointment. For evening dining high end prices but poor decor and limited menu choices. All mains same price regardless of whether chicken or rack of lamb. Drink prices were considerably higher than the setting would lead you to expect. eg. $8 beer, $40 for a store priced $10 bottle of wine. Cost wasn't an issue for us - but it was hard to justify the value.
reviews.title: Very relaxing

reviews.text: Great place, 3 nice pools, tennis courts, golf and heaps of other activities. Plenty to do at the resort and in town which is only a short drive away. Also lovely beach accessible from the resort.
reviews.title: Our 3 Night Stay

reviews.text: Over all the whole family had a good time and will deffinatly be coming back. Four Stars
reviews.title: Relaxing Stay
Beachside stopover
reviews.text: This was our third stay at this hotel in four yrs. once again we found friendly staff, good food and a relaxing atmosphere. Our daughter always enjoys the pools and helps keep her occupied.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms seem to be undergoing a partial makeover. One thing I would recommend is an upgrade of the bathrooms. just look tired compared to the rest of the room.
reviews.title: Could do with more room facilities

reviews.text: All up a very nice relaxing holiday which is what you need after a hard yr of work.
reviews.title: Lovely, but the rooms and the exterior could do with a freshen up.

reviews.text: For a Novotel hotel, this is very disappointing. Our family of 4 booked a night in a 1 bedroom spa suite on our drive from Brisbane to Sydney. Upon arrival at the hotel, seeing the watermarks running down building beside the hotel name was a hint of things to come. When we got to our room, our fears were confirmed. The room and furnishings were dated and we found cobwebs between the bedroom and the bathroom.
reviews.title: Old & poorly maintained property, poor value for money

reviews.text: Between the bedroom and the living room was a half-height counter, with a multi-panel wooden partition on top. We could close the panels but they cannot be secured, so don't expect any privacy. We call the reception asking them about the extra bed we ordered for our kids. They said there was the sofa bed in the living room, we can set it up ourselves. This is the first time we has to set up beddings ourselves in a hotel. At least they brought extra pillows we asked for. The sofa bed dipped to the center, and you could feel the springs especially at the edges.
reviews.title: Beautiful grounds, disappointing rooms.
Coffs
reviews.text: There was a washing machine and dryer, which came in very handy. However, they were situated in a "closet" in the bedroom without ventilation. So the floor of that tiny closet was completely wet after drying our clothes and the moisture got into the bedroom. The carpet near the closet was also very damp. We had to switch on the air-condition to dry up the room even though the outside temperature was nice and cool.

The resort is a 5-minute drive from town, so not a place to stay unless you have a car. The grounds are superb, boasting a lovely golf course, sensational views with a little waterfall and magnificent vistas of the mountains in the background.
reviews.title: A little tired, but still an excellent resort and good value besides.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are reasonable, but could do with an update. They are a good size, with flat screen TVs (with very few channels), aircon and a king sized bed, but rather tired.
reviews.title: Great grounds, rooms & some facilities a bit tired

reviews.text: Breakfast is excellent, with a wide selection of cereals, yoghurt, hot meals including eggs, sausages, baked beans etc., fruits, reasonably nice patisserie selection. We got a good deal on wotif of $189 including the breakfast.
reviews.title: Peaceful setting

reviews.text: We stayed here in March 2004 while travelling by car from Sydney to Brisbane. Being just over half way between the two Coffs Harbour makes a perfectly timed stop to break up the journey. The resort is a perfect place to relax. We stayed in an upper level spa suite and were not dissapointed. As stated they are very spacious with a seperate living area and fully equipped kitchen as well as a nice bathroom with large spa bath. There is little need to leave the hotel with all the facilities. We used a couple of the pools and had a treatment at the spa (floatation tank) which was a new experience.
reviews.title: perfect getaway or short break

reviews.text: Had a light lunch at the restaurant which was very nice and not too overpriced. There are also plenty of options nearby or you can always cook yourself in your room.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!
Okay for a short break...
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night in a 1 bedroom spa suite.

aka: Novotel Coffs Harbour Pacific Bay Hotel Coffs Harbour
description: The Novotel Coffs Harbour Pacific Bay Resort is a 4 star hotel located 10 minutes drive from the centre of Coffs Harbour. Perfect for a holiday or break on the beautiful New South Wales North Coast, the hotel features 170 superbly appointed rooms, plus arestaurant, bar and conference rooms for up to 500 people. Guests can enjoy excellent leisure facilities, including a 9 hole golf course, tennis and volleyball courts, three swimming pools, indoor and outdoor spas, fitness centre and Tranquility Day Spa
